source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_017_chunk2
evidence_span: Irradiation was carried out in three rigs in the Dido reactor at Harwell, with one rig operating at $5 5 3 \pm 1 0 \mathrm { K }$ in a peak flux of $7 . 3 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 7 } \mathrm { n / m ^ { 2 } / s e c }$ and the other two at $3 5 3 \pm 1 0 \mathrm { K }$ in peak fluxes of $1 1 . 6 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 7 } \mathrm { n / m ^ { 2 } / s e c }$ and $5 . 6 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 7 } \mathrm { n } / \mathrm { m } ^ { 2 } / s$ , respectively.
